properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 1:06AM EST until January 5 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...SNOWY AND WINDY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THIS MORNING ACROSS
THE NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS...

.Lingering moisture will allow for light snow showers to continue
across the North Carolina mountains through this morning. Gusty
northwest winds will continue as well, especially at the higher
elevations.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of less than one inch
are possible through the morning hours. Winds gusting as high
as 50 mph on the ridges.

* WHERE...The mountains of western North Carolina.

* WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...With temperatures below freezing and wet roads, or
snow covered roads, slippery road conditions are expected.
Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Please report snow and ice accumulations by calling the National
Weather Service toll free at...1...800...2 6 7...8 1 0 1. Leave a
message with your observation and the specific location where it
occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather
Service Greenville Spartanburg Facebook or tweet your report
using hashtag nwsgsp.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of
weather information for the latest updates. Additional details
can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING
